pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 193, 304, 209]]<|/det|>
# FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 217, 154, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 440, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF10)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 327, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 433]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 448, 285, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of a calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 907, 540]]<|/det|>
Results obtained solely from a graphic calculator, without supporting working or reasoning, will not receive credit.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 541, 606, 557]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 571, 606, 586]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 587, 756, 603]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 72, 616, 94]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r = 2\mathrm{e}^{\theta}\), for \(\frac{1}{6}\pi \leqslant \theta \leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\). Find

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 101, 148, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 100, 715, 122]]<|/det|>
the area of the region bounded by the half-lines \(\theta = \frac{1}{6}\pi\), \(\theta = \frac{1}{2}\pi\) and \(C\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 127, 151, 146]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 127, 287, 146]]<|/det|>
the length of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 127, 920, 146]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 173, 97, 192]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 173, 858, 193]]<|/det|>
The cubic equation \(x^{3} - px - q = 0\), where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants, has roots \(\alpha\), \(\beta\), \(\gamma\). Show that

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 198, 148, 217]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 198, 303, 217]]<|/det|>
\(\alpha^{2} + \beta^{2} + \gamma^{2} = 2p\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 200, 920, 218]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 225, 151, 244]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 225, 303, 244]]<|/det|>
\(\alpha^{3} + \beta^{3} + \gamma^{3} = 3q\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 250, 151, 269]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 250, 529, 269]]<|/det|>
\(6(\alpha^{5} + \beta^{5} + \gamma^{5}) = 5(\alpha^{3} + \beta^{3} + \gamma^{3})(\alpha^{2} + \beta^{2} + \gamma^{2})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 252, 920, 271]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 297, 96, 316]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 297, 237, 316]]<|/det|>
It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 319, 584, 355]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \sum_{r = 1}^{n}u_{r} = 2n^{2} + n.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 361, 823, 381]]<|/det|>
Write down the values of \(S_{1}, S_{2}, S_{3}, S_{4}\). Express \(u_{r}\) in terms of \(r\), justifying your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 362, 920, 381]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 392, 160, 410]]<|/det|>
<label>Find</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 411, 532, 452]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = n + 1}^{2n}u_{r}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 420, 920, 440]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 483, 96, 502]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 483, 237, 502]]<|/det|>
It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 502, 591, 549]]<|/det|>
\[I_{n} = \int_{0}^{1}\frac{x^{n}}{\sqrt{(1 + 2x)}}\mathrm{d}x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 551, 288, 570]]<|/det|>
Show that, for \(n \geqslant 1\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 571, 593, 592]]<|/det|>
\[(2n + 1)I_{n} = \sqrt{3} -nI_{n - 1}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 571, 920, 590]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 606, 203, 625]]<|/det|>
Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 625, 562, 648]]<|/det|>
\[I_{3} = \frac{2}{35} (\sqrt{3} + 1).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 625, 920, 644]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 693, 96, 712]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 688, 494, 712]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = (1 + x)^{2} \ln (1 + x)\). Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{3}y}{\mathrm{d}x^{3}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 694, 920, 712]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 730, 613, 749]]<|/det|>
Prove by mathematical induction that, for every integer \(n \geqslant 3\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 755, 601, 790]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{n}y}{\mathrm{d}x^{n}} = (-1)^{n - 1}\frac{2(n - 3)!}{(1 + x)^{n - 2}}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 764, 920, 783]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 732, 92]]<|/det|>
The linear transformation \(\mathbf{T}: \mathbb{R}^{4} \to \mathbb{R}^{4}\) is represented by the matrix \(\mathbf{M}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[383, 96, 616, 166]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{M} = \left( \begin{array}{cccc}1 & -3 & -1 & 2 \\ 4 & -10 & 0 & 2 \\ 1 & -1 & 3 & -4 \\ 5 & -12 & 1 & 1 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 170, 697, 189]]<|/det|>
Find, in either order, the rank of \(\mathbf{M}\) and a basis for the null space \(K\) of \(\mathbf{T}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 170, 920, 189]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 199, 193, 217]]<|/det|>
Evaluate

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[453, 214, 544, 284]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{M}\left( \begin{array}{c}1\\ -2\\ -3\\ -4 \end{array} \right),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 285, 423, 304]]<|/det|>
and hence show that every solution of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 306, 554, 377]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{M}\mathbf{x} = \left( \begin{array}{c}2\\ 16\\ 10\\ 22 \end{array} \right)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 380, 222, 399]]<|/det|>
has the form

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 395, 591, 465]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{x} = \left( \begin{array}{c}1\\ -2\\ -3\\ -4 \end{array} \right) + \lambda \mathbf{e}_{1} + \mu \mathbf{e}_{2},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 467, 598, 487]]<|/det|>
where \(\lambda\) and \(\mu\) are real numbers and \(\{\mathbf{e}_{1}, \mathbf{e}_{2}\}\) is a basis for \(K\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 469, 920, 487]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 509, 96, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 508, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
The square matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) has \(\lambda\) as an eigenvalue with \(\mathbf{e}\) as a corresponding eigenvector. Show that \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of \(\mathbf{A}^{2}\) and state the corresponding eigenvalue.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 555, 470, 574]]<|/det|>
Find the eigenvalues of the matrix \(\mathbf{B}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 577, 576, 631]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{B} = \left( \begin{array}{ccc}1 & 3 & 0 \\ 2 & 0 & 2 \\ 1 & 1 & 2 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 644, 710, 664]]<|/det|>
Find the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{B}^{4} + 2\mathbf{B}^{2} + 3\mathbf{I}\), where \(\mathbf{I}\) is the \(3 \times 3\) identity matrix.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 700, 96, 720]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 688, 823, 737]]<|/det|>
The plane \(\varPi_{1}\) has equation \(\mathbf{r} = \left( \begin{array}{c}2\\ 3\\ -1 \end{array} \right) + s\left( \begin{array}{c}1\\ 0\\ 1 \end{array} \right) + t\left( \begin{array}{c}1\\ -1\\ -2 \end{array} \right)\). Find a cartesian equation of \(\varPi_{1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 743, 792, 763]]<|/det|>
The plane \(\varPi_{2}\) has equation \(2x - y + z = 10\). Find the acute angle between \(\varPi_{1}\) and \(\varPi_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 771, 918, 791]]<|/det|>
Find an equation of the line of intersection of \(\varPi_{1}\) and \(\varPi_{2}\), giving your answer in the form \(\mathbf{r} = \mathbf{a} + \lambda \mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 789, 920, 808]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 831, 96, 848]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 829, 425, 848]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[353, 852, 645, 873]]<|/det|>
\[x = t^{2},\quad y = t - \textstyle \frac{1}{3} t^{3},\quad \text{for} 0\leqslant t\leqslant 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 878, 806, 897]]<|/det|>
Find the surface area generated when \(C\) is rotated through \(2\pi\) radians about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 878, 920, 897]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 907, 865, 926]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the centroid of the region bounded by \(C\), the \(x\)-axis and the line \(x = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 907, 920, 926]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 106, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 326, 92]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 94, 571, 128]]<|/det|>
\[y = \frac{p x^{2} + 4 x + 1}{x + 1},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 131, 443, 149]]<|/det|>
where \(p\) is a positive constant and \(p \neq 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 163, 153, 180]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 163, 517, 180]]<|/det|>
Obtain the equations of the asymptotes of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 163, 918, 180]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 194, 153, 212]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 193, 821, 212]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(p\) for which the \(x\)-axis is a tangent to \(C\), and sketch \(C\) in this case.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 194, 918, 212]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 153, 243]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 224, 920, 259]]<|/det|>
For the case \(p = 1\), show that \(C\) has no turning points, and sketch \(C\), giving the exact coordinates of the points of intersection of \(C\) with the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 242, 918, 259]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 286, 104, 305]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 286, 527, 305]]<|/det|>
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 325, 201, 344]]<|/det|>
<label>EITHER</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 356, 698, 375]]<|/det|>
State the fifth roots of unity in the form \(\cos \theta + \mathrm{i}\sin \theta\), where \(-\pi < \theta \leqslant \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 357, 918, 375]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 387, 193, 405]]<|/det|>
<form>Simplify</form>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 406, 692, 427]]<|/det|>
\[\left(x - \left[\cos \frac{2}{5}\pi +\mathrm{i}\sin \frac{2}{5}\pi\right]\right)\left(x - \left[\cos \frac{2}{5}\pi -\mathrm{i}\sin \frac{2}{5}\pi\right]\right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 444, 354, 462]]<|/det|>
Hence find the real factors of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[468, 463, 528, 483]]<|/det|>
\[x^{5} - 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 464, 918, 483]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 500, 411, 518]]<|/det|>
Express the six roots of the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 523, 559, 544]]<|/det|>
\[x^{6} - x^{3} + 1 = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 552, 524, 570]]<|/det|>
as three conjugate pairs, in the form \(\cos \theta \pm \mathrm{i}\sin \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 552, 920, 570]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 584, 354, 602]]<|/det|>
Hence find the real factors of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 602, 544, 622]]<|/det|>
\[x^{6} - x^{3} + 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 603, 920, 622]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 647, 153, 664]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 678, 207, 695]]<|/det|>
Given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[329, 694, 668, 730]]<|/det|>
\[y^{2}\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{d}x^{2}} -6y^{2}\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +2y\left(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\right)^{2} + 3y^{3} = 25\mathrm{e}^{-2x}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 737, 326, 755]]<|/det|>
and that \(\nu = y^{3}\), show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 757, 603, 791]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}\nu}{\mathrm{d}x^{2}} -6\frac{\mathrm{d}\nu}{\mathrm{d}x} +9\nu = 75\mathrm{e}^{-2x}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 768, 920, 787]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 810, 821, 838]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution for \(y\) in terms of \(x\), given that when \(x = 0\), \(y = 2\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 816, 920, 835]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 873, 920, 910]]<|/det|>
